channel.title: iServer - Nice combat - Just enough to get started with Hyperion
channel.description:
[center]I hope you guys like this, Merry Christmas! :D
It's just a Christmas gift because when it's finished I will be selling it. (Yes that means I'm still developing it :p)
[b]iServer[/b] [i]A simple jump to RSPS[/i]
[b]Why it's simple.[/b] iServer is a RSPS created from the infamous Hyperion (revision 317). It was created for easy use, anybody (with no programming experience at all) can modify their server with one simple editor. This editor was created in C#, and runs off the .NET framework (there is also a less complex Java editor for non-Windows users ;)). Within, a user is engaged with panels to modify their server at any time, and update the server information WITHOUT SERVER REBOOT. This can be used to edit the following: Server name, administrator's, moderator's, login messages, experience rate, and server port (required restart obviously).
[img]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/15018011/controlcentre.png[/img]
[b]Why it's great.[/b] This product is no ordinary server either! It includes elegant content as well. [b]The combat triangle[/b] works precisely as RuneScape's. One with good skills will prevail in fights - winning a fight does not completely depend on the armour you're wearing as RuneScape today. It looks realistic and acts realistic. This server's performance matches Hyperion as well.
NOTE: The arrow projectile being delayed is because of the lag I get when recording. (Sorry about this)
[img]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/15018011/combatpre.gif[/img] [img]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/15018011/magemeleecombo.gif[/img]
[img]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/15018011/magicshort.gif[/img] [img]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/15018011/mageshortbowspec.gif[/img]
[img]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/15018011/rangedefemotes.gif[/img]
[img]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/15018011/gmaul.gif[/img]
[img]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/15018011/proladders.gif[/img]
[img]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/15018011/loginscreen.png[/img]
Merry Christmas! If you downloaded, I'd like to hear any comments/concerns, so post them here! [url=http://dl.dropbox.com/u/15018011/hyperion_server.zip]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/15018011/hyperion_server.zip[/url]
NOTE: Graham included an amazing ondemand cache server called jaggrabs, SO USE IT![/center]

item.dc:creator: @saint_alx saint alx
item.description:
@saint_alx wrote:

[quote=“Onix, post:10, topic:375200”][quote author=saint alx link=topic=470958.msg3994465#msg3994465 date=1337082640]

do I need a source to use with the server?

A source is a server…

Okay… so this download is useless? :o
[/quote]What are you talking about? You bumping a 5 month old topic with junk is useless imo…

If you have a source, you don’t really need another one now do you?[/quote]
But the sources are all different? And can you run a source without a client then?

Btw thanks for your help so far, bear with me >_<

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

This isn’t bad, but the special handling is extremely incorrect. The client has 2 configs, one for special amount, and one for toggling of special. Use them.

That is a neat idea for on the fly changes to certain config options though.
